channel.title: R on Using Databases in R
channel.description: Recent content in R on Using Databases in R

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: Start by first connecting to the database, Drivers section describes how to accomplish that. List tables dbListTables(con) ## [1] "airlines" "airport" "airports" "faithful" "flights" "iris" Upload data to the database library(nycflights13) data(package = "nycflights13") dbWriteTable(con, "airlines", airlines) List Fields dbListFields(con, "iris") ## [1] "Sepal.Length" "Sepal.Width" "Petal.Length" "Petal.Width" ## [5] "Species" Run a query Using the appropriate SQL syntax for the type of connection, you can use the dbGetQuery run queries.
